div.div: Commented on #1568 Modified behavior of --help/-h and added commands -H/--help--all

can we avoid having redundant if/else statement instead just have one place perhaps at bottom where we add all the hidden parsers. You might just want to declare some variable for hidden parsers maybe here is one idea hidden_parser = { 'docs' : "Open buildtest docs in browser", 'schemadocs': "..." (1 more line was trimmed) Then you could do the following for command, help_msg in hidden_parser.items(): subparser.add_parser(command, help=help_msg) If you want to capture aliases also then you will need to update the dictionary with more keys. This would require a bit refactoring. Another question is do we need to do subparsers.add_parser in the else statement? I take it this is not required since the argparse will only need to build add hidden parsers when -H is specified otherwise it is not needed
Reviewed #1568 Modified behavior of --help/-h and added commands -H/--help--all

Merge pull request #1574 from buildtesters/buildtest_perlmutter_tutorial_update
update Perlmutter tutorial
Commented on #1568 Modified behavior of --help/-h and added commands -H/--help--all
this seems silly we dont need two variables help1 and help2 . It also not readable. This can be a one liner show_all_help = "-H" in sys.argv or "--help-all" in sys.argv
Reviewed #1568 Modified behavior of --help/-h and added commands -H/--help--all

please reorder the options so -H first followed by -V
